data.title: Great inauguration ceremony for the successful rebuild of PM3 at Norske Skog Bruck
data.meta_description: After eight months of intensive rebuild work, PM3 "Emma" produces sustainable packaging paper from recycled fibers.
data.text:
Among others, important representatives from federal and state politics, society and the press were invited to the official opening on June 22. With 210,000 t of sustainable packaging paper per year and biogas generation, the rebuild is considered a showcase project in the field of sustainability and modernization. Christopher Drexler speaks of a forward-looking project. “In total, an exemplary case, we can only congratulate Norske Skog and all responsible parties!“ says the governor of Styria. The containerboard products for corrugated board production will be marketed under the new brand name “Strato”.

An ambitious rebuild to shape our future

During the rebuild phase, in addition to the site’s approximately 450 employees, another 500 craftsmen and specialists were working simultaneously at the company to meet the ambitious project schedule and enable the plant to restart on schedule. “It’s the transformation of a generation project, so to speak. And we got off to a sensational start with it right away,” continues Managing Director Enzo Zadra.

120 million euros were invested in the rebuild of the 70-year-old newspaper machine, a waste paper treatment plant and biogas plant. This has opened up a completely new chapter in production. The new PM3 produces 600 tons of new packaging paper daily from 650 tons of recovered board. This makes the line highly efficient “We produce 100% sustainable recyclable packaging paper,” emphasizes Enzo Zadra. The new waste paper preparation plant built by Bellmer also plays an important role in this. The completely new stock preparation system and the rebuild of the approach flow system support the energy-efficient concept.

REBUILD OF THE WIRE SECTION AND FORMER

The recently installed TurboFormer is a first-class hybrid former that offers the best formation and increases the capacity in the forming section of the paper machine.

REBUILD OF THE PRESS SECTION WITH INSTALLATION OF A SHOE PRESS TURBOPRESS XL

The „XL“ module is the most powerful shoe module, capable of handling the highest loads and speeds while ensuring efficient dewatering and formation. The module is equipped with a hydrostatically mounted TurboRoll SZ counter roll. The TurboRoll EN, on the other hand, is equipped with a unique and patented shoe loading and lubrication system that ensures correct and even loading across the entire width.

MODIFICATION OF THE PRE- AND POST-DRYING SECTION

Efficient drying is guaranteed with the new TurboDryer drying cylinders in the first drying group. The stock has been optimally utilised and energy consumption in the drying section has been reduced as much as possible. The steam-heated TurboDryer cylinders are made of cast iron. The new hood from Bellmer for sustainable energy recovery, in conjunction with the energy-efficient steam and condensate system, rounds off the sustainable energy concept of the Norske Skog Bruck production plant.

TURBOFILM SIZER WITH AIRTURN

The new TurboFilm Sizer ensures the best quality in paper sizing and pre-coating. It is complemented by the new Bellmer starch unit.

POPEREELER TURBOREELER

Roll diameters up to over 4 metres (max. 3.2 metres in Bruck) can be wound with the TurboReeler without interruption. It is also equipped with the BellDur winding hardness control system and BellCheck diagnostic system.

AUTOMATIC TRANSPORT SYSTEM TURBO TRANSPORTER PRO

The transporter guarantees safe, even and efficient transport of the jumbo rolls to the winder.

TURBOWINDER

The team at Norske Skog opted for a TurboWinder to not only fully optimise the winding and unwinding process, but also to ensure the best quality of the finished rolls.

The fully automated finishing group consisting of TurboReeler, TurboTransporter and TurboWinder also benefits work safety and efficiency. The TurboReeler and the complete final group concept were customised and manufactured in Germany.

New pulpers under the press section, sizer, reeler and winder round off the scope of delivery for the STRATO project.

About Norske Skog

The Norske Skog Bruck site was founded in 1881 and today employs around 450 people. In the past four years, a total of around 200 million euros has been invested in the conversion of paper production and future-oriented energy facilities. In addition, a power plant for regional substitute fuels has been commissioned, reducing dependence on fossil natural gas and at the same time cutting fossil CO2 emissions by three quarters. At the same time, the greater Bruck area is supplied with district heating.
